cluster_relations.rel_desc: Fairytales captivate and engage global audiences around the world.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Narrative works that capture and hold the attention of audiences.
Narrative works or stories emotionally captivate or enchant their audience.
remarks: Pronoun "These" resolved to timeless stories derived from famous fairytales.
Pronoun "These" resolved to timeless stories derived from famous fairytales.

cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Narrative works or stories emotionally captivate or enchant their audience.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Fairytales are said to provide valuable insights into the human experience.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Narrative works that offer conceptual or emotional understanding of an aspect of human life or experience.

args.canonical_rel_desc: A narrative work captures and holds the attention of its audience.
args.justification: This relation describes how fairytales captivate audiences, which is an affective/engagement response similar in nature to the 'enchants_audience' relations. Aligning the rel_cls with 'audience_affective_response_relation' and rel_cls_group with 'AFFECTIVE_EFFECT' groups it consistently with the other audience-response edges, while slightly tightening the canonical_rel_desc to focus on audience engagement.

args.canonical_rel_desc: A narrative work offers conceptual or emotional understanding of an aspect of human life or experience.
args.justification: This relation is about fairytales giving insight into the human experience, which is epistemic rather than purely affective or generic effect. Defining a more specific class 'narrative_insight_relation' and assigning the broad group 'EPISTEMIC_EFFECT' better captures that this is an understanding/knowledge effect, not just a generic narrative effect.

executed_decisions.justification: This relation is about fairytales giving insight into the human experience, which is epistemic rather than purely affective or generic effect.
